Headline: This is due to lower production at the Barrancabermeja refinery due to maintenance work.
Article: “The plan includes adjustments in some facilities of the refinery, a greater shipment of diesel from the Cartagena refinery to the interior of the country, changes in the use and management of existing inventories, imports, an increase in the percentage of biodiesel that is mixed with diesel and a greater dispatch of tank trucks to some of the main consumption centers,” explained Ecopetrol.

Title: Ecopetrol activates contingency plan for attack on Caño Limón oil pipeline
Headline: Alleged ELN attack on the Coveñas oil pipeline
Article: Alleged ELN attack on the Coveñas oil pipeline The Colombian Caño Limón-Coveñas oil pipeline suffered a new attack with explosives that caused an oil spill and forced the activation of a contingency plan to reduce environmental pollution, the state-owned Ecopetrol reported on Monday.

Bicentennial to transport more than 50,000 barrels of crude oil per day

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species
Article: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species One of the most important riches of the national geography is its variety of species, both flora and fauna

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species
Article: So much so that the country is the first in birds, with 1,876 registered species, it also occupies the first places in amphibians, thanks to its 700 species and currently has the fourth most varied population of mammals in the world, with 456 species, among other figures in which Colombia remains among the first world occupations

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species
Article: However, this reality has led to several threatened species in the country as well.

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species
Article: According to figures from the Ministry of the Environment, between flora and fauna there are already 1,302 threatened species in Colombia, of which 182 are currently listed as critically endangered, that is, they are facing an extremely high risk of extinction in wildlife; 431 in danger, understood as those whose risk of extinction in wildlife is very high; and 689 in a state of vulnerability, which suffer from a high risk of disappearing

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species
Article: Faced with this, the Ministry commands a series of projects to protect flagship species of national ecosystems such as the Andean condor, sea turtles, the plains caiman or felines.

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species
Article: Independent associations are also working for the preservation of these species and additionally private parties contribute their grain of sand so that the country maintains its biodiversity and widespread natural wealth.

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species
Article: The oil company chaired by Felipe Bayón was part of the Wildlife Project, which, in a first stage between 2014 and 2017, focused on improving the living conditions for 10 species in Magdalena Medio and the Orinoquía.

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species
Article: Since last year, the program was resumed, with the incorporation of five additional species, native to Putumayo's own ecosystems.

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species
Article: Currently, the project is being carried out to ensure the protection, in the Magdalena Medio area, of the striped catfish, the brown spider monkey, the Caribbean manatee, the blue-billed curassow and the red carreto tree.

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species
Article: Regarding the work being carried out in the Eastern Plains, in the Orinoco sector, there are the tapir, the moriche palm, and the conger eel tree.

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species
Article: The species that entered the second stage of the project, in the Putumayo area, were the pink cedar tree, the black tinamou, the ocelot, the churuco monkey and the white-lipped peccary.

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species
Article: "The species are chosen considering the concept of threat and complementarity, and logically that they are typical of the territories

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species
Article: First, it is determined which are the threatened species present in the area to be intervened, then they are selected considering that they use different habitats, that they are important in the ecosystem, that they are recognized by the communities and that they face threats in the territory.

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species
Article: The objective is that the mixture of species contributes to the comprehensive conservation of the entire landscape and the functioning of the ecosystems," clarified Santiago Martínez, Environmental Performance Manager of Ecopetrol.

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species
Article: According to the Ministry of the Environment, the different species that inhabit the Colombian territory, such as those previously highlighted, suffer from various threats to their conservation, among which are illegal trafficking, introduction of exotic species, expansion of the agricultural frontier, transformation and habitat fragmentation, and climate change

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country
Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country

Title: Companies that protect endangered species of fauna and flora in the country

Headline: Ecopetrol collaborates with the conservation of 15 species

Title: Pemex would pay more taxes despite promises from President Amlo

Title: Pemex would pay more taxes despite promises from President Amlo
Headline: The company would have a higher tax burden than its state peers, according to an oil consultant from IPD Latin America.
Article: Andrés Manuel López Obrador (Amlo), president of Mexico, has promised to give new impetus to the indebted oil company Pemex with a larger budget, but paradoxically he has proposed that the state giant pay even more taxes next year

Title: Pemex would pay more taxes despite promises from President Amlo
Headline: The company would have a higher tax burden than its state peers, according to an oil consultant from IPD Latin America.
Article: If the proposal of López Obrador's leftist government is approved in Congress, Pemex would contribute more income to the federal government than the resources that legislators would assign to it for its spending.

Title: Pemex would pay more taxes despite promises from President Amlo
Headline: The company would have a higher tax burden than its state peers, according to an oil consultant from IPD Latin America.
Article: "Pemex's tax burden is punitive, it is extremely high and does not allow Pemex to reinvest," said John Padilla, a Bogotá-based oil consultant at IPD Latin America.

Title: Pemex would pay more taxes despite promises from President Amlo
Headline: The company would have a higher tax burden than its state peers, according to an oil consultant from IPD Latin America.

Headline: The company would have a higher tax burden than its state peers, according to an oil consultant from IPD Latin America.

Title: Learn about the books recommended by the CEOs of the best sellers

And what is the present and future of humanity? Furthermore, he calls on how in the 21st century censorship is exercised, not by blocking access to information, but by flooding with irrelevant data, which causes distraction and misinformation.

Title: Learn about the books recommended by the CEOs of the best sellers

Title: Escape of minority shareholders of Ecopetrol
Headline: The mission of the capital market has the great challenge of analyzing the causes of this massive exile of stock market investors in Colombia
Article: The mission of the capital market has the great challenge of analyzing the causes of this massive exile of investors from the stock market in Colombia. At the end of 2007, when the first public offering of Ecopetrol shares was made, the stock market in Colombia celebrated with euphoria. the arrival of 482,698 new partners to the oil company, which helped multiply by 5.7 times the number of stock investors in just 8 years, going from 125,000 in 1999 to around 835,000 in 2007, a figure that was also boosted with other new issues of actions during that time range such as those of Grupo Aval (1999 and 2007), ISA (2000, 2002 and 2007), ETB (2003) and Isagen (2007)

Title: Escape of minority shareholders of Ecopetrol
Headline: The mission of the capital market has the great challenge of analyzing the causes of this massive exile of stock market investors in Colombia
Article: Later in 2011, the second issue of Ecopetrol shares was made, where the company reached the number of 521,740 members, which meant that the stock market, helped with about 15 new issues and registrations of different companies, managed to have a little more than 1,000,000 participants, equivalent to 2.2% of the population in Colombia

Title: Escape of minority shareholders of Ecopetrol
Headline: The mission of the capital market has the great challenge of analyzing the causes of this massive exile of stock market investors in Colombia
Article: Since 1999, the number of investors in the stock market had increased 7 times, a very appreciable growth in 12 years.

Title: Escape of minority shareholders of Ecopetrol
Headline: The mission of the capital market has the great challenge of analyzing the causes of this massive exile of stock market investors in Colombia
Article: Few would have imagined that this growing trend in investors would change drastically over the next few years.

Title: Escape of minority shareholders of Ecopetrol
Headline: The mission of the capital market has the great challenge of analyzing the causes of this massive exile of stock market investors in Colombia
Article: From 2011 to September 2018, the equity market has lost close to 445,000 investors, of which 217,000 have left Ecopetrol, losing 42.7% of its partners, which are equivalent to 48.8% of the total number of people who have left the stock market en masse

Title: Escape of minority shareholders of Ecopetrol
Headline: The mission of the capital market has the great challenge of analyzing the causes of this massive exile of stock market investors in Colombia
Article: To top it all off, as of September 2018 there were 560,000 investors left in the stock market of which 52%, with 291,000 shareholders, are from Ecopetrol, and of them 90.38%, that is, 263,616 partners of the oil company have less than 5,000 shares that are equivalent to an investment portfolio of less than $15 million (share price $3,000)

Title: Escape of minority shareholders of Ecopetrol
Headline: The mission of the capital market has the great challenge of analyzing the causes of this massive exile of stock market investors in Colombia
Article: At the end of 2018, there will be 7 years of massive investor exit, which has affected the interest of new participants in the stock market, market liquidity and price formation of most shares.

Title: Escape of minority shareholders of Ecopetrol
Headline: The mission of the capital market has the great challenge of analyzing the causes of this massive exile of stock market investors in Colombia
Article: The worst thing is that for the year 2019 there are no changes in this trend and if the participation of Ecopetrol is excluded, the equity market will decline in number of participants to 2002 levels.

Title: Escape of minority shareholders of Ecopetrol
Headline: The mission of the capital market has the great challenge of analyzing the causes of this massive exile of stock market investors in Colombia
Article: The stock brokerage companies themselves have focused their commercial strength and sales strategy towards other products such as Collective Investment Funds (FIC's), abandoning the promotion of the stock market in individuals with low amounts.

Article: The minority shareholders of Ecopetrol and the rest of the companies sell their shares en masse and leave the market, fleeing from high administration charges and no level of advice due to having portfolios of lower value

Article: The mission of the capital market has the great challenge of analyzing the causes of this massive exile of investors from the stock market in Colombia, such as the high costs of portfolio management and transactions for minority shareholders, intermittent advice, technological deficiencies and lack of education. financial and stock market culture in the population

Title: Escape of minority shareholders of Ecopetrol
Headline: The mission of the capital market has the great challenge of analyzing the causes of this massive exile of stock market investors in Colombia
Article: Corruption and bribery scandals in issuers linked to the infrastructure sector and public sector, adding to the low impact that minority partners have in shareholder meetings and company decisions, make people prefer to leave the capital market by not feeling supported or represented

Article: It is worth asking the stock market and stock exchange directors in Colombia: Are they interested in deepening the stock market in terms of issuers, intermediaries and investors? This matter can no longer wait.

Title: The price of oil comes back and plays
Headline: The WTI benchmark oil barrel closes at the lowest level since September 2017 and the dark clouds over oil dependence return
Article: The WTI benchmark oil barrel closes at the lowest level since September 2017 and the dark clouds over oil dependence return The relationship between the Colombian economy and oil prices is like an eternal déjà vu

Title: The price of oil comes back and plays
Headline: The WTI benchmark oil barrel closes at the lowest level since September 2017 and the dark clouds over oil dependence return
Article: Only from August 2014 onwards did we realize the high dependence that the national coffers have on the export of crude oil, just when the economy came to a screeching halt and we saw how the country's finances were stripped bare in the face of the bad situation, which devastated Ecopetrol's numbers, in an unprecedented situation, but which in the end was well managed, leaving a deep mark on the growth figures

Title: The price of oil comes back and plays
Headline: The WTI benchmark oil barrel closes at the lowest level since September 2017 and the dark clouds over oil dependence return

Title: The price of oil comes back and plays

Title: The price of oil comes back and plays

Title: The price of oil comes back and plays

Article: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries, OPEC, recently announced supply cuts of 1.2 million barrels per day starting in January to push prices up, a situation supported by other non-OPEC producers such as Russia, but despite the constant pressures for the market to react, the price of fuel has not been able to stabilize at the ceiling of US$80

Title: The price of oil comes back and plays

Article: The problem is structural for Colombia and nothing different from the fact that it depends on oil exports not only to improve its finances, but the National Government has in Ecopetrol a source of income, similar to tax revenues, characteristics that have not been possible. change in recent decades, despite the diagnoses and criticism of the high dependence on crude oil

Title: The price of oil comes back and plays

Article: The oil price crisis of 2014 made the national economy aware of living in a kind of undeclared “Dutch disease”, since all growth and the generality of economic sectors were affected by the fall in value. of the barrel of oil

Article: No plans were made to support non-traditional exports or to take advantage of more than a dozen free trade agreements signed by the country in the last decade, plus a good exchange rate; As things stand, Colombia once again finds itself in the same situation of dependence on crude oil prices because it has not known how to transform the economy.

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: The number is small when comparing with the region

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: 20 years ago, as the 20th century was ending, the stock market in Colombia had 44 stock brokerage companies that served those who wanted to invest in the stock market through the three stock exchanges that existed: the Bogotá Stock Exchange, the Medellín Stock Exchange and the Western Stock Exchange in Cali

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: Then, after the merger of the three entities in 2001 to create the Colombian Stock Exchange (BVC), the market had 40 commission firms.

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: For the issuance of Ecopetrol shares in 2007, the largest and most successful in the market in terms of amount and number of investors, 34 of the 38 stock brokerage companies in force at the time participated.

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: During the following years, the number of stock market intermediaries was reduced due to mergers and liquidations, the most important being Interbolsa in 2012.

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: Currently, despite the evolution of the stock market in this century, where new share issues managed to reach 1,000,000 investors in the variable income market, the number of active stock brokerage companies is only 19. , less than half of what there was 20 years ago

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: Is this number of firms enough to meet the investment needs of the population in Colombia? The only entities in the country authorized to provide the service of buying and selling securities in the stock market are stock brokerage firms.

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: In fact, if a local pension fund with the portfolio of its affiliates, a foreign fund or even a state company wants to buy or sell shares in the market, they must necessarily contact a stock brokerage.

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: The 580,000 investors that the stock market had as of June 2018 would have to do the same.

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: When comparing the number of securities intermediaries with other countries in the region that are part of the Latin American Integrated Market (Mila), it can be seen that the stock market in Colombia has the smallest number of firms: Mexico has 33, Chile has 26 and Peru, 24

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: Not to mention the stock market in the United States, which has more than 1,300 entities.

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: Furthermore, when observing the accumulated financial statements of the stock brokerage firms as of September 2018, it is seen that only 11 firms out of the 19 present highly positive results, while the other eight firms strive to stop losses, where two entities accumulate higher losses. to $2 billion

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: There remain six commission firms with independent capital, the rest are banked or belong to a holding company, and in the halls of the stock market there is talk of the merger of at least two entities that will further reduce the number of stock market intermediaries.

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: Currently, just 10 entities have control of 95% of the stock market in terms of number of operations and amount traded in all variable income products, which include cash operations, repos and temporary transfer of securities.

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: One of the challenges of the Stock Market Mission is to encourage the creation of more intermediaries in said market

Title: Are 19 stock brokers enough?
Headline: The number is small when making a comparison with the region.
Article: Although it is difficult to determine an adequate number of these entities, the truth is that a small number of firms hinders the possibility of millions of Colombians with investment capacity being able to access the stock market and the collective investment funds offered by these intermediaries.

Headline: This is how the refinery has evolved since its creation.
Article: Its entry was achieved thanks to a merger between the International Petroleum Company (IPC), a subsidiary of the Imperial Oil Company, and the Tropical Oil Company, a company with the right to produce oil in the Mares Concession, located in the region of Barrancabermeja, Santander. , where the refinery currently operates

Title: Volatility will set the pace at the end of the year
Headline: The dollar is above $3,100 after the Brent barrel fell 4.24%, many stocks lost what they had gained
Article: The dollar is above $3,100 after the fall of the Brent barrel, which fell 4.24%, many actions lost what they had gained. This October only has six business days left to recover from the volatile economic days that have marked the last few weeks, loaded with uncertainty in all secondary markets, which remain nervous due to the political and energy tensions that have their epicenter in Saudi Arabia: policies due to the murder of the journalist, Jamal Khashoggi, an event that has strained relations with Turkey; and energy, because the Arab kingdom itself confirmed that it is willing to redesign the global energy market, that means no longer playing to continue raising crude oil prices.

Article: All Colombians carry this company in their hearts and there are some people who have launched proposals to sell the entire company and I want to say that it will continue to belong to all Colombians, because we are not thinking about its total sale," said Duque.

Title: Ecopetrol will concentrate resources on drilling during the rest of the year: CEO
Headline: Ecopetrol celebrated ten years on the New York Stock Exchange
Article: Ecopetrol celebrated ten years on the New York Stock Exchange Colombian state oil company Ecopetrol SA will focus its expenses for the rest of the year on increasing drilling activity and obtaining operational licenses, its executive president said on Friday.

Title: Ecopetrol will concentrate resources on drilling during the rest of the year: CEO
Headline: Ecopetrol celebrated ten years on the New York Stock Exchange
Article: Felipe Bayón said in an interview on the New York Stock Exchange that completing a capital expenditure plan of between $3 billion and $3.5 billion this year will be a challenge, due to the postponements suffered in early 2018.

Article: The firm celebrates 10 years on Wall Street and for this reason, its president will start today's rally. The Colombian oil company celebrates a decade since it was listed on the New York Stock Exchange on September 18, 2008, so its president, Felipe Bayón, was invited to ring the bell that signifies the opening of the markets today

Headline: The firm celebrates 10 years on Wall Street and therefore, its president will start today's rally
Article: During this decade Ecopetrol “was transformed,” Bayón highlighted, pointing out achievements such as “doubling oil and gas production; enter new businesses such as biofuels and petrochemicals; modernize its refining and transportation infrastructure; become a business group with operations in Colombia, the United States, Brazil, Mexico and Peru; and contribute more than $200 billion to the Nation between royalties, taxes and dividends”

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: "We can end the year with self-sufficiency greater than six years" 2018 began with a recovery in oil prices, which generated great expectations in the industry in the country, since it could generate a reactivation of the sector and improve the figures in terms of production and resources for the country

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: In an interview with Colprensa, the president of the National Hydrocarbons Agency (ANH), Orlando Velandia, takes stock of the sector in the first half of the year, the expectations at the end of 2018 and the changes in contracting for exploration, among others. topics

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: What is the balance of the sector during this first half of the year and the projections at the end? Thanks to the prices that crude oil has maintained in this first half and to the actions that we have been taking in the current years, we already have clear signs of recovery in the sector, not only in terms of production, exploratory activity, in the mobilization of drills in search of new resources but also to develop existing deposits

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: These reactivation indicators are the result of a better price level and stabilization, which is an important factor, because it is not enough for the price to rise but for it to stabilize, because that is what allows companies to do their recovery planning. investment

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: In addition, we have carried out some activities to give contractual signals that allow us to have a better scenario and a more encouraging future in the oil industry.

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: What are the expectations at the end of 2018? Although there are some concerns about demand levels, where there may be a reduction worldwide that could generate some drop in prices, we do not believe that in the short term there will be a significant reduction in prices, which would allow us that at the end of the year in this second semester we will not only have a level above 855,000 barrels of daily production, approaching 860,000, but also that this price level will make it easier for us to project royalties collection, which are very important for the regions, we can have goals met and a reactivation in social investment in the country

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: From many fronts there is already talk of a reactivation of the sector

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: What are those signs that lead you to think this? A driving factor in this industry is seeing contractual and institutional signals to facilitate operations and keep price levels stable.

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: The best response to these signals is that companies are mobilizing their drills to operate, either to take out the overdraft or to find new reserves.

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: What are the expectations regarding exploration? After having critical figures in 2016, where we only explored 21 wells, last year we managed to drill 54 and our goal for this year is to exceed this figure

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: We have to take into account that a large part of these exploratory commitments are carried out in the second half of the year during the dry season and in some regions we will have to wait for the rains to stop before entering the field and setting up the drills.

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: So far we have 25 wells so far this year and that is why we hope that in this second half we will be surpassing the 54 that we did in 2017, because we can have greater industry activity in the regions

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: With this expectation of recovery, the ANH has announced changes in hiring

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: One of them is the modification to offshore contracting

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: What does it consist of? We had signed technical evaluation contracts with several of the companies in the Colombian Caribbean Sea, which are already reaching their final part and the companies have options to convert to exploration and production contracts, that is, allowing them to undertake the drilling of wells and look for hydrocarbons in those areas

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: But the contractual conditions that we had in Colombia were not being viewed well by many of those companies, because we were not competitive in the contractual terms in relation to other countries such as Mexico, Brazil, Argentina and Canada itself.

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: In this way, we needed to make an adjustment and a thorough review of those contractual terms and place ourselves at the forefront of those countries in competitive matters.

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: We made that adjustment and a little over a month ago we promulgated the new off shore contractual minutes, which in the opinion of many experts places us on par with several countries in the region and has been well received by the industry.

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: In fact, we have already been notified by the companies of their intention to switch to exploration and production contracts, which will allow us to search for those hydrocarbons and, if possible, start producing.

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: What expectations do you have for the future with this change in hiring? What we can begin to do is convert all those areas that were in technical evaluation contracts and transfer them to exploration and production contracts, which allows us to give a huge reactivation to all oil activity in the Caribbean Sea.

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia
Headline: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency"
Article: In fact, an element that has also been vital for this interest of the companies is the discovery of four wells in the Caribbean Sea and that also attracts the interest of the companies, but we had to adjust those contractual terms and not waste the opportunities we had.

Title: "We can end the year with more than six years of self-sufficiency": Velandia

", a plug or barrier that prevents reservoir fluids from reaching the wellhead"

Title: Caño Limón-Coveñas Pipeline resumes operation after 180-day paralysis
Headline: The paralysis of pumping did not affect the production of the Caño Limón fields because the oil was evacuated through another pipeline.
Article: The Colombian Caño Limón-Coveñas oil pipeline resumed operations after a 180-day paralysis due to a series of attacks by the National Liberation Army (ELN) guerrilla and the theft of crude oil with illegal valves, military and oil sector sources reported on Tuesday.

Title: Caño Limón-Coveñas Pipeline resumes operation after 180-day paralysis
Headline: The paralysis of pumping did not affect the production of the Caño Limón fields because the oil was evacuated through another pipeline.
Article: The 773-kilometer-long pipeline, which suffered its longest paralysis since it began operating in December 1985, has been the target of 58 attacks this year attributed to the ELN, to which is added the discovery of 41 illicit valves for theft of crude

Title: The inopportune idea of ​​insurers
Headline: The insurers' idea of ​​going out to sell Ecopetrol just when prices begin to rebound went down badly among their colleagues.
Article: The idea of ​​the insurers to go out and sell Ecopetrol just when prices begin to rebound went down poorly among their colleagues. The proposal of Fasecolda, a union that brings together insurance companies operating in the country, to sell the shares held by the State in Ecopetrol, is inconvenient, inopportune and quite imprudent in light of the international economic situation, the entry of a new National Government and of course due to the rise in the price of oil so far this year, a situation that will surely will hold for several more months

Title: The inopportune idea of ​​insurers
Headline: The insurers' idea of ​​going out to sell Ecopetrol just when prices begin to rebound went down badly among their colleagues.
Article: Although the idea had been presented as an official document of the Guild Council, an organization where all the unions of the local economy meet, the president of the insurance companies, former minister Jorge Humberto Botero, came out to clarify that the idea only commits them, a proposal from which the National Business Association (Andi) distanced itself, which did not take long to express its disagreement, opening a crack in the unified positions that business groups should have at this time of new air for the politics and economics

Title: The inopportune idea of ​​insurers
Headline: The insurers' idea of ​​going out to sell Ecopetrol just when prices begin to rebound went down badly among their colleagues.
Article: The insurers may be right that high oil prices are a strong argument for selling the joint company well, since offering Ecopetrol a barrel at less than US$50 would be a disaster; It may also be based on the fact that Saudi Arabia will dispose of its stake in Aramco, the state-owned company of the largest crude oil producer, in 2019.

Title: The inopportune idea of ​​insurers
Headline: The insurers' idea of ​​going out to sell Ecopetrol just when prices begin to rebound went down badly among their colleagues.
Article: Or perhaps it is based on more theoretical arguments such as the necessary disinvestment of the State in all sectors, words that have been heard in all privatizations, which by the way have left a very bitter taste for Colombians; from the same transfer of the province of Panama for which a handful of dollars were received supposedly to build the railways, obviously passing through the exit of the shares of Carbocol, the electrification companies, Telecom, many official banks and more recently Isagen

Title: The inopportune idea of ​​insurers
Headline: The insurers' idea of ​​going out to sell Ecopetrol just when prices begin to rebound went down badly among their colleagues.
Article: Former Minister Botero says that there is a need to guarantee the country's macroeconomic and fiscal stability and the importance of strengthening competitiveness, for which it is necessary to continue with the road infrastructure that the current Government has been working on.

Title: Proposal to sell Ecopetrol assets is an initiative of Fasecolda

Article: Resources would go to the development of road infrastructure Despite the fact that some media presented a proposal on behalf of the National Trade Council, where the president-elect, Iván Duque, is asked to sell the State's shares within Ecopetrol, Jorge Humberto Botero, president of The Federation of Colombian Insurers (Fasecolda), explained that the idea is solely theirs.

Title: Proposal to sell Ecopetrol assets is an initiative of Fasecolda
Headline: Resources would go to the development of road infrastructure
Article: Botero clarified that he was presenting the document, not as president of the Union Council, but as a director of Fasecolda, and explained that what he seeks with this measure is that "resources from oil revenue be released and public assets are replaced by others, to impact national economic growth and, therefore, employment in a long cycle,” said the manager.

Title: Ecopetrol will make changes to its management structure to increase efficiencies
Headline: The oil company modified its management structure to align it with the stage of growth and competitiveness.
Article: The oil company modified its management structure to align it with the stage of growth and competitiveness

Title: Ecopetrol will make changes to its management structure to increase efficiencies
Headline: The oil company modified its management structure to align it with the stage of growth and competitiveness.
Article: Ecopetrol reported that considering the challenges of the company's strategy and as part of its consolidation and transformation process, the company modifies its management structure to align it with the stage of growth and competitiveness.

Title: Ecopetrol will make changes to its management structure to increase efficiencies
Headline: The oil company modified its management structure to align it with the stage of growth and competitiveness.
Article: The operational executive Vice Presidency with direct reporting to the Presidency, will be made up of the Vice Presidency of Development and Production, Vice Presidency of Exploration, Vice Presidency of Refining and Industrial Processes, Vice Presidency of Projects and Engineering, Vice Presidency of Transportation Operations and Maintenance, Colombian Petroleum Institute (ICP), Operational Planning Management and HSE Management

Title: Ecopetrol will make changes to its management structure to increase efficiencies
Headline: The oil company modified its management structure to align it with the stage of growth and competitiveness.
Article: The Commercial and Marketing Vice President will have a direct report to the President of the company.

Title: Ecopetrol will make changes to its management structure to increase efficiencies
Headline: The oil company modified its management structure to align it with the stage of growth and competitiveness.
Article: As part of the modification to the structure, the Executive Vice Presidency of Strategy and Finance (VEF) is created with direct reporting to the Presidency, which will be made up of the Vice Presidency of Human Talent, Financial Vice Presidency, Vice Presidency of Strategy and Transformation, Vice Presidency of New Business, Digital Vice Presidency and Regulatory Strategy Management

Title: Ecopetrol will make changes to its management structure to increase efficiencies
Headline: The oil company modified its management structure to align it with the stage of growth and competitiveness.
Article: The Executive Vice Presidency of Strategy and Finance will be headed by María Fernanda Suárez Londoño, the Vice Presidency of New Businesses will be Juan Manuel Rojas Payán and the Financial Vice Presidency will be Jaime Caballero Uribe.

Title: Ecopetrol will make changes to its management structure to increase efficiencies
Headline: The oil company modified its management structure to align it with the stage of growth and competitiveness.
Article: All changes will become official starting July 16.

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: The companies would have violated free competition. The Superintendence of Industry and Commerce (SIC) imposed a sanction on the companies Bureau Veritas Colombia and Tecnicontrol, both controlled by Bureau Veritas International, which would have violated free competition by participating. in a tender before Ecopetrol

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: “The Superintendency, after an investigation of several years, determined that Bureau Veritas and Tecnicontrol had pretended to compete in that bidding process when in reality they were not competing, they were coordinating their offers,” explained the Superintendent of Industry and Commerce, Pablo Felipe Robledo.

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: By pretending that both companies were competing and submitting similar offers, they altered the average award, that is, the average of the offers, so it tended towards their proposal, guaranteeing that Bureau Veritas Colombia won the $27 billion tender.

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: In fact, the SIC established that both companies, which are known for accrediting compliance with the rules by the companies, manipulated their offers in such a way that the one presented by one was the complement of the other.

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: “This is a violation of the rules of free competition, which is why the Superindustry imposed a fine on those two companies that, in total, amounts to $13.7 billion, and constitutes one of the highest fines that the SIC has imposed. the last few years,” said Robledo.

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: The SIC announced that the sanction against Bureau Veritas Colombia is $3,218.72 million and that of its legal representative, Renato Macedo de Catrib Filho, is $144.53 million.

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: Likewise, Tecnicontrol must pay $10,156.15 million and its legal representative, René Omar Pedraza Acuña, $339.84 million.

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: The SIC investigation began in 2016, after the entity received a complaint in which it was pointed out that both companies had interests in common as they belonged to the same international firm and that their participation in the tender before Ecopetrol would have been coordinated to increase the chances of either of the two being awarded the contract

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: The SIC was able to establish the relationship between both companies through emails, documents, expert opinions and statements from the employees of the companies involved, since although the purchase process of the companies was carried out between 2012 and 2013, it was only until 2015 that the officially documented the integration process

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: THE CONTRASTESPablo Felipe RobledoSuperintendent of Industry and Commerce“A paradox, a company that certifies good business practices ends up violating free competition”

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: Through these same elements of evidence, the SIC determined that the companies coordinated the offers for the tender and that their legal representatives not only knew about the unfair competition practices, but also participated and directed them.

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: It is worth mentioning that this decision has an appeal for reconsideration before the Superintendent and that this will be studied if the companies involved decide to present it.

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: LR tried to communicate with the companies to find out if they will present the appeal and their version of the events, but at the time of going to press it was not possible.

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: What was the tender before Ecopetrol? The tender mentioned in this case is a call made by Ecopetrol with the purpose of awarding a contract to transport oil in tank cars.

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: At the time, eight interested companies presented themselves to the process, of which in the end five were authorized, among them Bureau Veritas Colombia, which obtained the tender, and Tecnicontrol

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: The Superintendency of Industry and Commerce highlighted that the investigation into these unfair practices in the bidding process does not involve Ecopetrol or its employees or its managers.

Title: Superintendence of Industry and Commerce sanctions Bureau Veritas companies
Headline: The companies would have violated free competition
Article: Nor does it imply sanctions on any of them.

Title: The SIC fined Bureau Veritas Colombia and Tecnicontrol for irregularities in the Ecopetrol tender
Headline: The sanctions are for more than $13.7 billion
Article: The sanctions are for more than $13.7 billion. In a press release, the Superintendency of Industry and Commerce indicated that it fined Bureau Veritas Colombia and Tecnicontrol, as well as their legal representatives, for more than $13.7 billion, because they “simulated or pretended to be competing companies in the tender when in reality they acted in a coordinated and concerted manner, for the benefit of the Bureau Veritas International Group, to which both companies belonged."

Title: The SIC fined Bureau Veritas Colombia and Tecnicontrol for irregularities in the Ecopetrol tender
Headline: The sanctions are for more than $13.7 billion
Article: The history of the tender dates back to 2013, when the oil company began a contracting process for $27,000 million, which "had the objective of contracting the “consulting for the evaluation and monitoring of HSE performance for Ecopetrol S.A.”, that is, supervision in matters of safety, occupational health and environment (Health, Safety & Environment – ​​HSE)"

Title: The SIC fined Bureau Veritas Colombia and Tecnicontrol for irregularities in the Ecopetrol tender
Headline: The sanctions are for more than $13.7 billion
Article: La Super explained that its decision is based on elements such as emails, expert opinions and even employee testimonies.

Title: The SIC fined Bureau Veritas Colombia and Tecnicontrol for irregularities in the Ecopetrol tender
Headline: The sanctions are for more than $13.7 billion
Article: Furthermore, on page 33 of the SIC resolution it is seen that the economic proposals of the offers from Bureau Veritas ($26,327,226,148) and Tecnicontrol ($26,313,447,558) presented in the tender were very similar, which made it easier for a of them, in this case Bureau Veritas, will win the tender

Title: The SIC fined Bureau Veritas Colombia and Tecnicontrol for irregularities in the Ecopetrol tender
Headline: The sanctions are for more than $13.7 billion
Article: Finally, the SIC stressed that the investigated conduct does not involve Ecopetrol or any of its directors.

Title: Ecopetrol announces the commercialization of the Infantas Oriente field in Barrancabermeja
Headline: Early development plan approved to drill 20 wells this year
Article: An early development plan was approved to drill 20 wells this year. Through a statement, Ecopetrol, as operating partner in the La Cira-Infantas collaboration contract, declared the commerciality of the Infantas Oriente field, located in the rural area of ​​Barrancabermeja, Santander

Title: Ecopetrol announces the commercialization of the Infantas Oriente field in Barrancabermeja
Headline: Early development plan approved to drill 20 wells this year
Article: This field is located 3 kilometers from the La Cira-Infantas field and very close to the Barrancabermeja Refinery, which will allow taking advantage of synergies with these operational areas.

Title: Ecopetrol announces the commercialization of the Infantas Oriente field in Barrancabermeja
Headline: Early development plan approved to drill 20 wells this year
Article: According to the oil company, the discovery well (Infantas Oriente-1) reached its objective at the beginning of this year, at a depth of approximately 600 meters, with the presence of crude oil in a thickness of 15 meters.

Title: Ecopetrol announces the commercialization of the Infantas Oriente field in Barrancabermeja
Headline: Early development plan approved to drill 20 wells this year
Article: In tests, the well produced more than 250 barrels per day of light oil, 33 degrees API

Title: Ecopetrol announces the commercialization of the Infantas Oriente field in Barrancabermeja
Headline: Early development plan approved to drill 20 wells this year
Article: For this year, an early development plan was approved to drill 20 wells, with which an initial incorporation of proven developed reserves is estimated, of which Ecopetrol would have 52%

Title: Ecopetrol announces the commercialization of the Infantas Oriente field in Barrancabermeja
Headline: Early development plan approved to drill 20 wells this year
Article: Next year, a complementary development plan will be executed with a focus on primary recovery, which includes the drilling of 47 additional wells.

Title: Ecopetrol announces the commercialization of the Infantas Oriente field in Barrancabermeja
Headline: Early development plan approved to drill 20 wells this year
Article: In addition, progress is being made in defining the field development plan with secondary recovery, through water injection, which will allow the incorporation of more reserves in the medium and long term.

Title: Ecopetrol announces the commercialization of the Infantas Oriente field in Barrancabermeja
Headline: Early development plan approved to drill 20 wells this year
Article: This area was where the oil industry in Colombia was born 100 years ago.

Title: Ecopetrol announces the commercialization of the Infantas Oriente field in Barrancabermeja
Headline: Early development plan approved to drill 20 wells this year
Article: The La Cira-Infantas field, located very close to the new discovery, has significantly increased its production in the last 12 years, going from 5,000 barrels per day in 2005 to 46,000 barrels per day currently.

Title: Former Reficar board directors charged with fiscal responsibility
Headline: The imputation of fiscal responsibility for US$2.4 billion covers, among others, Javier Gutiérrez and Orlando Cabrales.
Article: The former presidents of Reficar were also charged with joint and several fiscal liability for contributing to the loss of investments in the project: -Orlando Cabrales Martínez and Reyes Reinoso Yanes -Magda Manosalva, former administrative and financial vice president -Carlos Bustillo Lacayo and Andrés Virgilio Riera Burelli, former vice presidents of project -Cesar Luis Narco García, corporate project director of Ecopetrol The delegated controller Noguera Rodríguez also imputed joint and several fiscal responsibility for the entire US$2,433 million of impaired investments to the multinational contractors of the project: CBI Americas ltd., Chicago Bridge & Iron Company (cb&i) UK limited, CBI colombiana s.a., Foster Wheeler USA corporation and Process Consultants, inc.

Title: The successor of Juan Manuel Santos will receive a recovering economy
Headline: Exports, 4g routes and lower inflation will be key to the rebound
Article: Exports, 4G routes and lower inflation will be key to the rebound RELATED ARTICLE Exports, increased trade and 4G works would lead GDP to grow 2.6% this year Last year, the Colombian economy experienced one of its most difficult periods in eight years: Local activity grew a bittersweet 1.8%, dragged down by the falls in mining exploitation (-3.6%), manufacturing (-1.0%), construction (-0.7%) and transportation ( -0.1%) in a year marked by the impact of the 2016 Tax Reform; the adjustment of inflation, and the slow recovery of oil prices

Title: The successor of Juan Manuel Santos will receive a recovering economy
Headline: Exports, 4g routes and lower inflation will be key to the rebound
Article: However, both analysts and financial entities and international organizations consider that the new president would receive an economy that hit rock bottom and would recover in 2018, with an estimated acceleration in its GDP ranging from 2.3% (Anif) to 2.7%. (Banco de la República) and 3% in the best cases (International Monetary Fund), a forecast that could already be glimpsed with the 2.8% rebound in the first quarter

Title: The second economic news of the year
Headline: Colombia will begin to be part of the club of the 37 countries with best economic practices, great news that adds to the rise in oil
Article: Colombia will begin to be part of the club of 37 countries with the best economic practices, great news that adds to the rise in oil. Next May 30 in Paris, President Juan Manuel Santos and the Secretary General of the Organization for Cooperation and Development Economic Development (OECD), Ángel Gurría, will sign the Access Agreement that makes the country its 37th member, after having passed the different evaluations of 23 thematic committees and major silent reforms that seek to align legislation, public policies and government practices with the standards of the countries of the so-called “good practices club”

Title: The second economic news of the year
Headline: Colombia will begin to be part of the club of the 37 countries with best economic practices, great news that adds to the rise in oil
Article: Issues such as respect for international labor rules, the pending modernization of the judicial system, corporate governance of public companies, the fight against bribery and a good commercial environment, are steps that have been taken and that today make Colombia one of the 37 that walk firmly towards well-being and development hand in hand with the best

Title: The second economic news of the year
Headline: Colombia will begin to be part of the club of the 37 countries with best economic practices, great news that adds to the rise in oil
Article: Belonging to the OECD is like having an advisory board of directors from high government that teaches you the steps of progress and improvement

Title: The second economic news of the year

Article: The silent reforms that have been occurring for seven years in the country's business and economic framework are not minor; For example, progress has been made in making the elusive scrapping of vehicles the norm; New policies on industrial chemicals have been introduced at the national level and there is emerging waste management; while advancing a commitment to modernize the liquor sales scheme by region, the obsolete scheme of liquor stores as income from the departments that prevent the arrival of other products from different countries and even from the same local competition.
